value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Gen2
value.excerpt: At Microsoft Ignite, we found out about Power BI Premium Gen2. It's now available for you to use and WOW! It has changed the game! Adam walks you through what the changes are to help you level up.  Docs: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-what-is#power-bi-premium-generation-2-preview

value.title: Make your Power BI Visual POP with this column header trick
value.excerpt: There are different ways to change column headers for a table or matrix visual in Power BI. Adam covers a few common ways and leave you with a trick to make the visual POP!   📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: Sort month name chronologically in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Have you struggled when dragging month name to a chart axis and it is sorted alphabetically in Power BI Desktop? Adam shows you how you can change the sort order to be chronologically instead of alphabetically. This technique can also be used for other categorical columns in Power BI.  ******** LET'S

value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: You can take advantage of the R Script showcase to start using R Visuals with your reports. value.title: Where to create your columns in Power BI | Data Modeling Best Practices

value.title: Count of Unique Values DistinctCount in Power BI Through Power Query Group By Transformation
value.excerpt: You can have a distinct count calculation in multiple places in Power BI, through DAX code, using the Visual's aggregation on a field, or even in Power Query. If you are doing the distinct count in Power Query as part of a group by operation, however, the existing distinct count is for all columns in

value.title: Create a Table in Power BI using Enter Data and How to Edit it
value.excerpt: Sometimes you just need a new table with a few rows or columns to be added to your data model. One option to create that table is to use the Enter Data option in Power BI Desktop. In this article, I’ll explain how you can use it, and also; more important: How to edit the data of that table after creating

value.excerpt: When working with dates, one of the common types of analysis is period vs period, such as Year over year, and Month over month. value.title: Power BI Datamart – What is it and Why You Should Use it
value.excerpt: One of the newest additions to the Power BI components is the Datamart. Power BI Datamart is more than just another feature, it is a major milestone where the development of Power BI solutions will be revolutionized based on that. This is a feature that helps both citizen data analysts and developers.

value.title: Power BI From and To Date Filtering with One Slicer
value.excerpt: It happens that you might have two fields as From and To date (or Start and End date) in your dataset, and you want a date slicer in the report. The date slicer has to filter records in a way that the FROM and the TO dates are in the range of dates selected in the slicer. There are multiple ways of doing

value.excerpt: Computing the rolling 12-months average in DAX looks simple, but it hides some level of complexity.  This article explains how to write the best formula and how to avoid common pitfalls using time intelligence functions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Using ALLEXCEPT vs ALL VALUES
value.excerpt: ALLEXCEPT is a handy DAX function to retrieve all the columns of a table except for some. When used as a CALCULATE modifier, its behavior is less intuitive and might result in inaccurate measures. In this video, we elaborate on the most common mistake when using ALLEXCEPT in CALCULATE. Article and download:

value.title: Data analysis in Power BI
value.excerpt: Report authors can use additional features to enhance their reports for analytical insights in their data with features like Q&A and exporting. In this module, you will closely examine your data and Power BI reports and then extract value with deeper analysis. Additionally, you will learn how to sort data and how to present the report in a cohesive manner. You will learn how to get a statistical summary for your data and export data from Power BI. You will also apply and perform advanced analytics on the report for deeper and more meaningful data insights.

topItems.title: Perform analytics in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to use Power BI to perform data analytical functions, how to identify outliers in your data, how to group data together, and how to bin data for analysis. You will also learn how to perform time series analysis. Finally, you will work with advanced analytic features of Power BI, such as Quick Insights, AI Insights, and the Analyze feature.

topItems.title: Work with AI visuals in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: This module describes the AI capabilities of Power BI.

value.title: Work with AI visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: This module describes the AI capabilities of Power BI.

value.title: Create dashboards in Power BI
value.excerpt: Microsoft Power BI dashboards are different than Power BI reports. Dashboards allow report consumers to create a single artifact of directed data that is personalized just for them.  Dashboards can be comprised of pinned visuals that are taken from different reports. Where a Power BI report uses data from a single dataset, a Power BI dashboard can contain visuals from different datasets.

value.title: Create and manage workspaces in Power BI
value.excerpt: This module explains how you can share reports and datasets with your users and how to create a deployment strategy that makes sense for you and your organization. Furthermore, you will learn about data lineage in Microsoft Power BI.
